Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and black in section with white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and very faint traces of at least ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393265) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393265)
